p: On the other hand, the protective role of CD8 + T cells was ruled out based on experimental findings. Firstly, infection of CD8 deficient mice or CD8 + T cell‐depleted mice did not alter joint pathology or reduce viral load in the blood and tissues. 51 Next, adoptively transferred CHIKV‐specific CD8 + T cells induced upon live‐attenuated CHIKV vaccination failed to control CHIKV infection in mice. 52 Although CD8 + T cells have been linked to protection against RRV 48 and SINV, 47 findings in CHIKV suggest that CD8 + T cells play different roles in combating alphavirus infections.
